title: 108_hr3972
content: The Act titled "Protecting Our Children from Violence Act of 2004" allows state social services officers access to federal databases for specific purposes. The Attorney General can grant covered State social services officers online access to FBI databases for criminal history checks on individuals who resided with a minor during incidents of abuse or neglect. The Attorney General grants covered State social services officers access to FBI databases for missing persons checks related to investigations of missing children. The officers can only use this access for authorized purposes and must share any information obtained with relevant law enforcement agencies. The head of a State agency responsible for social services must certify to the Attorney General that an individual meets specific criteria to access FBI databases for missing persons checks related to investigations of missing children. The certification includes verifying the individual's role, authority, and compliance with Federal standards. The Attorney General may request additional information to support the certification. The term "State" encompasses the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and other U.S. territories, in relation to FBI's Criminal Justice Information Services Division. SEC. 3. Access to III by National Center for Missing and Exploited Children includes Case Analysis Division, Missing Children's Division, and Exploited Child Unit. Access is granted based on meeting Federal standards. SEC. 4. Privacy Protections are ensured. SEC. 4. PRIVACY PROTECTIONS. Information from checks or access under sections 2 and 3 cannot be altered except for national security reasons. It can only be shared with authorized individuals, and releasing it unlawfully can result in imprisonment or fines.
